description: Retrospective planning permission for a single storey rear extension with rear raised patio area and a proposed privacy screen to the rear patio area
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan,) shall be formed in the flank wall(s) of the building(s) hereby permitted, unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.
In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future.
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.
In the interests of the amenity of the occupiers of neighbouring dwelling.
The proposed privacy screen shown on the submitted drawings shall be erected within one month of the date of this decision.
In order to ensure that the raised patio area does not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the applicant and planning agent via email. The revisions involved the inclusion of a proposed privacy screen as part of the application. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 12/04/2024.
